description.p: The present invention relates to a paint grater for use in environments susceptible to explosions, comprising a housing, at least open in part at the bottom, and with an outlet connected to a suction unit for suction of material which comes loose during the process.

In connection with renovation and rebuilding of constructions offshore, old paint must often be removed. Removal of paint is often carried out in environments susceptible to explosion (EX), where stringent demands are made about the working temperature of the equipment that is used and how it affects the environment. Use of open flames and grinding tools that can lead to sparks and high temperatures are not allowed in such environments.

A work process to remove paint in such environments must leave the surface of the underlying metal free of residual paint and the process must not lead to temperatures above 60 °C. Furthermore, it must be possible for only one person to operate the process without being a strain on the environment with regard to smell, dust and noise. The process must also be able to be carried out in an offshore environment where the rules for danger of explosion must be followed.
From prior art, attention is given to GB 910399 A, US 2,997,730 A1, GB 821742 A, JP 2007159816 A, and US 5,727,995 A.

GB 821742 A relates to a device for removal of paint with a partially open housing with a rotating brush for removal of paint without providing additional heat. The brush is driven by an engine and the device has a suction unit connected to an outlet in the housing for sucking up of paint which comes loose during the process.

Said GB 821742 A shows a standard, known solution to rub away paint from a foundation with the help of a rapidly rotating brush which is driven by an electric motor, and where paint dust is sucked out of the housing. Such a device can not be used in an EX environment, where stringent demands are made with respect to fire safety, as the rapidly rotating brush will generate far too much heat, and will neither not give the necessary surface cleanliness that is required.

US 5,727,995 A disclose a surface penetrating tool for peening and removing coating from a surface, including a housing with an outlet for suction of material from the surface, and with a rotating peening tool. Said peening tool is driven by an air motor, which also creates an underpressure in the housing.

With the present solution, paint is not rubbed off the surface, but the paint is grated in such a way that a surface cleanliness of, for example, between 75 - 100 micron, can be provided. Furthermore, it is carried out at a very low temperature.
Consequently, it is an object of the present invention to provide a solution that satisfies all, or most of, the above mentioned requirements.

A person skilled in the arts that is faced with the problem of providing a solution for an EX environment, where a rotating file is pressed against the foundation will therefore not look to any of the documents described.

This object is achieved with a paint grater as described in the independent claim 1, in that the paint grater comprises a rotating file for low temperature grating of paint on an adjoining surface, in which the file and said suction unit are driven by an air motor, as said suction unit is arranged to provide an underpressure in the housing to force the rotating file against the foundation.
Alternative embodiments are given in the dependent claims 2 - 10.

The housing comprises preferably a number of valves and is equipped with elastic sealing strips against the foundation, whereby said valves are arranged to regulate the underpressure in the housing and the force of the rotating file against the foundation. Said valves can be spring loaded.
The air motor can be arranged to drive the file via a belt drive.
Said file can be formed in a circular-cylindrical form and be manufactured, in the main, from tungsten carbide.
Furthermore, the sealing strips can be arranged to be compressed to even out irregularities in the foundation, and the valves can be arranged to keep the underpressure in the housing constant.

In a further embodiment, the housing can be equipped with one or more magnetic rollers for propulsion of the paint grater along the foundation, where the magnetic roller and the rotating file can be driven by the air motor via a common belt drive. The magnetic roller can be connected to a reduction gear, arranged to adjust the propulsion speed across the foundation.

The invention shall now be explained with help of the enclosed figures, in which two example embodiments of the present invention are shown.
Figure 1 shows a first embodiment of the present invention.
Figure 2 shows a second embodiment of the present invention.
Other and further embodiments are also possible within the frame of the invention.

Figure 1 shows a paint grater 10 for use in environments that are susceptible to explosion. The paint grater 10 comprises a housing 12 at least partially open in the bottom, with a rotating file 14 for low temperature grating of paint on an adjoining surface (not shown). The housing 12 is closed to the environment at the top. The rotating file 14 is preferably driven by an air motor 16, but other drive means can also be used. Furthermore, a vacuum is formed inside the housing in that a suction unit is connected to an outlet 18 in the housing, as said suction unit is arranged to provide an underpressure in the housing to force the rotating file 14 against the foundation and to suck out material that comes loose during the process.

In the embodiment shown, the driving of the rotating file is provided via one or more belts, chains or the like 20, connected between a shaft of the file and a shaft of the air motor 16. Furthermore, the file 14 can be mounted in the housing 12 with sealed bearings which partially protect the bearings against paint dust and which ensure the underpressure in the housing.

Furthermore, the housing 12 comprises a number of valves 22, which, for example, can be spring loaded and the housing 12 is equipped with elastic sealing strips 24 against the foundation, for example, rubber strips. This implies that said valves 22 are arranged to regulate the underpressure in the housing and the force of the rotating file against the foundation.

If required, the paint grater 10 can thereby be held against the foundation with constant force if this is required, by the regulation of the valves 22 and due to the compression of the elastic sealing strips 24.

The rotating file 14 grates or cuts the paint off the surface of the foundation and can be manufactured in a circular-cylindrical form of, for example, more than 95% tungsten carbide. And also a special alloy that provides additional strength against wear and thereby extends the lifetime of the tool. The "teeth" of the file are cut in a special process and thus ensures that the file removes paint when it has contact with the foundation in such a way that the tool neither slides nor rubs against the foundation and thereby does not generate unnecessary heat. With the expression "low temperature" is meant temperatures in the main below 70 °C, and preferably in this context below 60 °C.
With background in the special rotating file, the speed of rotation can also be held low, for example, between 800 - 3000 rpm, which also leads to less heat generation.
Figure 2 shows a further embodiment of the solution shown in figure 1 and is, in the main, shaped in the same way. Similar parts are therefore given the same reference numbers.

As can be seen, the solution in figure 2 is additionally equipped with one or more magnetic rollers 26 for propulsion of the paint grater 10 along the foundation. The magnetic roller 26 can be mounted in the same way as the file 14. The magnetic roller 26 and the rotating file 14 are initially intended to be driven by the air motor 16 via a common belt drive 20,20'. As the magnetic roller 26 and the file 14 shall be able to rotate at different speeds, the magnetic roller 26 can be connected to a reduction gear, arranged to adjust the speed of propulsion of the paint grater 10 across the foundation.

claim.claim-text:
Farbabschaber (10) zur Verwendung in explosionsgefährdeten Umgebungen (EX), mit einem Gehäuse (12), welches zumindest teilweise am Boden geöffnet ist, und mit einem Auslass (18), welcher mit einer Absaugeinheit zum Absaugen von Material verbunden ist, welches während des Vorgangs abgelöst wurde,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass der Farbabschaber eine rotierende Feile (14) aufweist zum Niedrigtemperaturabschaben von Farbe auf einem angrenzenden Untergrund, wobei die Feile (14) und die Absaugeinheit durch einen Luftmotor (16) antreibbar sind, indem die Absaugeinheit ausgebildet ist, im Gehäuse (12) einen Unterdruck zu erzeugen, um die rotierende Feile (14) gegen den Untergrund zu treiben.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 1,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass das Gehäuse (12) eine Anzahl von Ventilen (22) aufweist und mit elastischen Abdichtstreifen (24) gegen den Untergrund ausgebildet ist, wodurch die Ventile (22) ausgebildet sind, den Unterdruck im Gehäuse (12) zu steuern und die rotierende Feile gegen den Untergrund zu treiben.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 2,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass die Ventile (22) federgespannt sind.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 1,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass der Luftmotor (16) ausgebildet ist, die Feile (14) mittels eines Band- oder Riemenantriebs (20) anzutreiben.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 1,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass die Feile (14) in einer kreiszylindrischen Gestalt ausgebildet ist und hauptsächlich aus Wolframcarbid besteht.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 1,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass das Gehäuse (12) mit einer oder mit mehreren magnetischen Walzen (26) zum Vorantreiben des Farbabschabers gegen den Untergrund ausgebildet ist.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 6,
dadurch gekenntzeichnet,
dass die magnetische Walze (26) und die rotierende Feile (14) durch den Luftmotor (16) mittels eines gemeinsamen Band- oder Riemenantriebs (20, 20') angetrieben werden.

Farbabschaber nach Anspruch 7,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass die magnetische Walze (26) mit einem Untersetzungsgetriebe verbunden ist, welches ausgebildet ist, die Geschwindigkeit des Vortriebs über den Untergrund anzupassen.

Farbabschaber nach einem oder nach mehreren der vorangehenden Ansprüchen,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass die Abdichtstreifen (24) ausgebildet sind, um komprimiert zu werden, um jegliche Unregelmäßigkeiten im Untergrund auszulöschen.

Farbabschaber nach einem oder nach mehreren der vorangehenden Ansprüche,
dadurch gekennzeichnet,
dass die Ventile (22) ausgebildet sind, den Unterdruck im Gehäuse (12) konstant zu halten.

Paint grater (10) for use in environments susceptible to explosions (EX), comprising a housing (12), at least in part open at the bottom, and with an outlet (18) connected to a suction unit for suction of material which has come loose in the process, characterised in that the paint grater comprises a rotating file (14) for low temperature grating of paint on an adjoining foundation, in which the file (14) and said suction unit are driveable by an air motor (16), as said suction unit is arranged to provide an underpressure in the housing (12) to force the rotating file (14) against the foundation.

Paint grater according to claim 1,
characterised in that the housing (12) comprises a number of valves (22) and is equipped with elastic sealing strips (24) against the foundation, whereby said valves (22) are arranged to regulate the underpressure in the housing (12) and force the rotating file against the foundation.

Paint grater according to claim 2,
characterised in that said valves (22) are spring loaded.

Paint grater according to claim 1,
characterised in that the air motor (16) is arranged to drive the file (14) via a belt drive (20).

Paint grater according to claim 1,
characterised in that said file (14) is manufactured in a circular-cylindrical shape and made, in the main, from tungsten carbide.

Paint grater according to claim 1,
characterised in that the housing (12) is equipped with one or more magnetic rollers (26) for propulsion of the paint grater along the foundation.

Paint grater according to claim 6,
characterised in that the magnetic roller (26) and the rotating file (14) are driven by the air motor (16) via a common belt drive (20,20').

Paint grater according to claim 7,
characterised in that the magnetic roller (26) is connected to a reduction gear arranged to adjust the speed of propulsion across the foundation.
Paint grater according to one or more of the preceding claims, characterised in that the sealing strips (24) are arranged to be compressed to cancel out any irregularities in the foundation.
Paint grater according to one or more of the preceding claims, characterised in that the valves (22) are arranged to keep the underpressure in the housing (12) constant.

Grattoir à peinture (10) destiné à être utilisé dans des environnements sensibles aux explosions (EX), comprenant un boîtier (12), au moins en partie ouvert au fond, et avec une sortie (18) raccordée à une unité d'aspiration pour l'aspiration du matériau qui s'est détaché lors du processus, caractérisé en ce que le grattoir à peinture comprend une lime rotative (14) pour gratter la peinture à basse température sur une base attenante, dans lequel la lime (14) et ladite unité d'aspixation peuvent être entraînées par un moteur pneumatique (16), étant donné que ladite unité d'aspiration est agencée pour fournir une sous-pression dans le boîtier (12) afin de forcer la lime rotative (14) contre la base.

Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que le boîtier (12) comprend un nombre de valves (22) et est équipé avec des bandes d'étanchéité élastiques (24) contre la base, moyennant quoi lesdites valves (22) sont agencées pour réguler la sous-pression dans le boîtier (12) et forcer la lime rotative contre la base.
Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 2, caractérisé en ce que lesdites valves (22) sont chargées par ressort.
Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que le moteur pneumatique (16) est agencé pour entraîner la lime (14) via un entraînement par courroie (20).

Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que ladite lime (14) est fabriquée selon une forme circulaire-cylindrique et réalisée, dans l'ensemble, à partir de carbure de tungstène.

Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que le boîtier (12) est équipé avec un ou plusieurs rouleaux magnétiques (26) pour la propulsion du grattoir à peinture le long de la base.

Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 6, caractérisé en ce que la rouleau magnétique (26) et la lime rotative (14) sont entraînés par le moteur pneumatique (16) via une entraînement par courroie (20, 20') commun.
Grattoir à peinture selon la revendication 7, caractérisé en ce que le rouleau magnétique (26) est raccordé à un engrenage de réduction agencé pour ajuster la vitesse de propulsion sur la base.

Grattoir à peinture selon l'une ou plusieurs des revendications précédentes, caractérisé en ce que les bandes d'étanchéité (24) sont agencées pour être comprimées afin de supprimer toutes les irrégularités dans la base.
Grattoir à peinture selon l'une ou plusieurs des revendications précédentes, caractérisé en ce que les valves (22) sont agencées pour maintenir la sous-pression dans le boîtier (12) constante.
